content:
In cognitive psychology, the concept of cognitive load refers to the total amount of mental effort being used in the working memory. This load can be affected by the complexity of the task and the individual's ability to process information. High cognitive load can lead to errors and decreased performance on tasks. However, strategies such as chunking information and using mnemonic devices can help manage cognitive load and improve performance.
Which of the following strategies is NOT typically used to manage cognitive load?
A. Chunking information
B. Using mnemonic devices
C. Increasing the complexity of the task
D. Reducing distractions
E. C. Increasing the complexity of the task
C. Increasing the complexity of the task
